alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Eau Claire (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 2:20AM CDT until August 03 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FOR CHIPPEWA AND NORTHEASTERN EAU CLAIRE COUNTIES... At 220 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Sheldon to near Stanley to 8 miles north of Fairchild, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of Chippewa and northeastern Eau Claire Counties, including the following locations... Holcombe, Lake Eau Claire County Park, Bateman, Ludington, Otter Lake, Jim Falls, Eagleton and Chippewa Moraine State Rec Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Twin Cities.
